intro: Ornithogalum dictaeum subsp. naxense, commonly known as the Naxos bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and clusters of bell-shaped white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological significance.
